rukus.text: Beholdest thou not that We have sent the satans upon the infidels inciting them by an incitement? *Chapter
So hasten thou not against them; We are only counting against them a counting. *Chapter
On the Day whereon We shall gather the God-feaing unto the Com- passionate as an embassy. *Chapter
And shall drive the culprits to Hell as a herd. *Chapter
They shall not own intercession, excepting those who have taken of the Compassionate a covenant. *Chapter
And they say: the Compassionate hath taken a son. *Chapter
Assuredly ye have brought a thing monstrous. *Chapter
Well-nigh the heavens are rent thereat and the earth cleft in sunder and the mountains fall down in pieces. *Chapter
That they should ascribe unto the Compassionate a son. *Chapter
And it behoveth not the Compassionate that he should take a son. *Chapter
None there is in the heavens and the earth but must come unto the Compassionate as a bondman. *Chapter
Assuredly He hath comprehanded them and counted them a full Counting. *Chapter
And each of them is to come to Him on the Day of Judgment alone. *Chapter
Verily those who believe and do righteOUs works--anon the Compassionate shall appoint for them affection. *Chapter
So We have made it easy in thine tongue in order that thou mayest thereby give glad tidings unto the Godfearing and warn thereby a people contentious. *Chapter
And how many a generation have We destroyed before them! Perceivest thou of them anyone or hear of them a whisper? *Chapter
